meanings.definition: Relating to the earth or its inhabitants.
meanings.sent1: The terrene soil was rich with nutrients for the plants.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the terrene environment to understand its ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The terrene creatures had a party underground.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a terrene landscape, filled with valleys of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The terrene landscape stretched out before us, vast and unexplored.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the land as distinct from the sea or air.
meanings.sent1: The terrene terrain was perfect for hiking.
meanings.sent2: Birds prefer the terrene environment over the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The terrene picnic was a hit with all the attendees.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts soared through the terrene skies of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The terrene ground felt solid beneath my feet as I walked.
